revised_title: Fossil Plants of the Lower Coal-Seams: Structure and Evolution in Lancashire and Yorkshire
tldr: The author examines fossil plants from the lower coal-seams of Lancashire and Yorkshire, providing detailed descriptions of their structure and evolution. The study reveals that Sigillaria gradually transforms into ribbed and furrowed Sigillaria as it ages, and that it possesses two woody cylinders and a central axis composed of hexagonal vessels. Evidence is also presented to support the idea that Stigmaria is the root of Sigillaria.
